title: Donjuan Triumphant seals emotional win for owners King Power at Ascot
text:
A week short of the anniversary of the helicopter crash which killed Leicester City chairman Vichai Srivaddhanaprabha, the horse racing empire poignantly enjoyed its biggest ever win.

The death of Srivaddhanaprabha has not dulled the appetite for racing success within the King Power operation now operated by children.

They enjoyed a first group one win when 33-1 shot Donjuan Triumphant powered through the final 50 yards of the draining Ascot home straight under Silvestre De Sousa to claw back favourite for a length victory in the Champion Sprint on British Champions day.

Donjuan Triumphant secured his first Group 1 win on his last run before retiring to stud

Six-year-old Donjuan Triumphant was running his last race and now heads to stud in France.

But his significance in the King Power operation will not be forgotten.

His trainer Andrew Balding, enjoying his best ever season with 123 wins and £3.3million in prizemoney said: 'This is the first horse the chairman ever bought and the first horse we had for him. It is just fantastic.'

King Power also own Fox Tal, who took fourth place behind Magical in the feature Champion Stakes.
description: A week short of the anniversary of the helicopter crash which killed Leicester chairman Vichai Srivaddhanaprabha, the horseracing empire poignantly enjoyed its biggest ever win.
authors: Marcus Townend For The Mail On Sunday
